worklogs.comment:
ozars commented on pull request #5369: ARROW-6552: [C++] boost::optional in STL test fails compiling in gcc 4.8.2
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5369
 
 
   It is reported in the mailgroup that string literals aren't implicitly convertible to `boost::optional<std::string>` in some old versions of gcc, causing compilation errors. This patch wraps such literals used in test cases with `std::string`.

bkietz commented on issue #5369: ARROW-6552: [C++] boost::optional in STL test fails compiling in gcc 4.8.2
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5369#issuecomment-530980324
 
 
   @ozars from locally running that docker container it looks like gcc 4.8.2 has trouble with the string literal operator as well (not your fault, that's actually from one of my PRs):
   
   ```
   /arrow/cpp/src/arrow/dataset/filter_test.cc:37:24: error: missing space between ‘""’ and suffix identifier
    using string_literals::operator""_;
                           ^
   ```
   
   I'll push a fix for that shortly

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++] boost::optional in STL test fails compiling in gcc 4.8.2

comments.body: Is there a simple way (such as Dockerfile) to test changes on gcc 4.8.2?

You can run the docker image which failed (working directory is arrow root):
{code:java}
$ docker run \
  -v $PWD:/arrow \
  -v $PWD:/io \
  quay.io/praveenbingo/arrow:buildGandivaDocker \
  /io/dev/tasks/gandiva-jars/build-cpp-linux.sh
{code}
(lifted from [https://travis-ci.org/ursa-labs/crossbow/builds/582833123#L489] )
